titleStmt.title: In some Copies, the Printer intreats the courteous Reader to correct these Errors.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: In some Copies, the Printer intreats the courteous Reader to correct these Errors.

monogr.title: The royall receipt: or, Hezekiahs physicke : A sermon deliuered at Pauls-Crosse, on Michaelmas Day, 1622. By Elias Petley
monogr.author: Petley, Elias

div.head: In some Copies, the Printer intreats the courteous Reader to correct these Errors.
div.p: Pag. 5. lin. 22. leaue out vgly, p. 18. l. 17. for boni cramp, read boyn, p. 33. l. 32. f. or, r. and. l. 35. f. euil, r. Dial, p. 34. l. 3. f. her, r. Hez. l. 23. f. relig, r. reliques, p. 37. l. 15. f. fulsie speech, r. fancie, Spectre. l. 17. f. idle, r. Idol, l. 23. f. immunitie, r. Mummie, l. 26. f. pain, r. punie, p. 36. l. 14. f. corded r. sordid, p. 37. l. 7. f. leaues, r leannesse, p. 38. l. 5. f. Aream, r. stream. There are other literall, figuratiue, and punctuall faults, which the Ingenuous will either mend or pardon. For Greeke I had none such Notes as I might not omit, I haue expressed in Italian Letter.
